metadata.synopsis: Dialogue after you destroy the cave-in and set Nere free. Thrinn has been put in charge of getting Nere out, but it's the player who accomplishes it. Nere almost just died from inhaling poisonous gas, so he's very angry. In this dialogue, you determine the fate of the gnomes as well as Nere and the mutinous duergar.

176.speaker: Nere
176.context: NodeContext: Said with great relief, but tinged with anger

44.speaker: Nere
44.text: Worthless slaves. Your incompetence has been my ruin.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnomesNodeContext: Intense but quietly so.

104.speaker: Nere
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: True Soul Nere prepares his spell, readying to attack the gnome Meerna. Nere strikes Meerna down with a magic attack, and raises his hand to strike down Beldron.NodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN! Rising, seething anger. Only the last word should be louder.

138.text: Stop! No more innocents will die today, Nere.
138.context: CinematicNodeContext: You, Nere, and Brithvar grip your heads in a mindmeld. Nere senses Brithvar through you.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: Stop! No more innocents will die today, Nere.
184.context: CinematicNodeContext: You, Nere, and Brithvar grip your heads in a mindmeld. Nere senses Brithvar through you.

216.speaker: Nere
216.text: So you care for the weak, True Soul. Was it your hand that slayed Nere's servants? Or is there a sane explanation?
216.context: CinematicNodeContext: You, Nere, and Brithvar grip your heads in a mindmeld. Nere senses Brithvar through you.

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Nere sifts through your memories - and a new presence clouds your mind. The duergar elder.*
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: You, Nere, and Brithvar grip your heads in a mindmeld. Nere senses Brithvar through you.

139.speaker: Nere
139.text: You care for the weak, True Soul. Most curious.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I came on the myconid sovereign's behalf. It demands revenge.

106.speaker: Nere
106.text: You heed an overgrown toadstool, yet defy a True Soul?

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I act on orders of the Absolute.

57.speaker: Nere
57.text: So you say. And yet the Absolute demands that I cull them.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Of course I care. I can't let these gnomes suffer.

152.speaker: Nere
152.text: The Absolute demands their slaughter. Yet here you stand, in bold defiance.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: This isn't about them. I just can't stand your face.

140.speaker: Nere
140.text: And yet you came to my aid.

59.speaker: Nere
59.text: A test - yes, you must be. The Absolute bade you to try Nere's faith.

157.speaker: Nere
157.text: I will tear out your heart and feed it to the rats.

31.speaker: Nere
31.text: Thrinn. Carve out their heart and serve it to the rothé.

62.speaker: Nere
62.text: If they are indeed a True Soul, let the Absolute save them.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: You wouldn't dare. I'm faithful to the Absolute.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

201.speaker: Nere
201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *Your scalp buzzes as Nere's mind reaches out - not to you, but to the nearby duergar.*
189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

125.speaker: Nere
125.text: Ah - I see treachery at every turn. Not every duergar proves faithful to the Absolute.

128.speaker: Nere
128.text: Nere is not without mercy, True Soul. These overgrown rats have given you a chance to earn my favour.

60.speaker: Nere
60.text: Strike them down. Prove your faith.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Side with Nere and the Absolutists.

123.speaker: Elder Brithvar
123.text: Shut your shitholes, both of yeh. You owe my crew a tenday's worth o' coin, Nere - and it's time you shell out.
123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar pulls out his dagger and points it at Nere.

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *The elder's disgust grips your head like a vice - yet he remains silent.*
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar mindmelds with the player and gives them the side eye.

174.speaker: Nere
174.text: Ah - another treacherous soul walks among us. Isn't that right, Brithvar?

6.speaker: Elder Brithvar
6.text: You been a shit since I laid eyes on you, red-eye. Go on, try and gut me. I ain't going down easy.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Nere. Brithvar pulls out a dagger and points it at Nere.

182.text: Direct your blade at the heretic, duergar. You shall have your coin.

108.speaker: Nere
108.text: Direct your blade at the heretic, duergar. You shall have your coin.

64.speaker: Elder Brithvar
64.text: You're damned right I'll have it. Me and that one, we got a deal. We beat your arse and dig the dues out from your carcass.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Nere. Nod to player when saying 'that one'.

13.speaker: Nere
13.text: You bargained with this wretch? How vexing.

55.speaker: Nere
55.text: Nere is not without mercy, True Soul. The rat has given you a chance to earn my favour.

145.speaker: Nere
145.text: Strike him down. Prove your faith.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Side with Brithvar and the rebels.

79.speaker: Elder Brithvar
79.text: Damn right I'll have it - straight off your rotted corpse.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: That's your cue, Brithvar. It's time you got paid.
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar pulls out his dagger and points it at Nere.

76.speaker: Elder Brithvar
76.text: Damn right it's time. You owe my crew a tenday's worth o' coin, Nere - and the reckoning's come.
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar pulls out his dagger and points it at Nere.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You so much as touch me, and I'll tear you from limb to limb.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: This battle will make a good story. Come, then.

148.speaker: Nere
148.text: The Absolute guides my hand. You've chosen a battle you cannot win.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Try it. I'll cut you all down.

2.speaker: Nere
2.text: I see your idiocy is only surpassed by your ego.

214.speaker: Player
214.text: I'll slit your throats before you can blink.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: In your eulogy, I'm going to call you a 'Twat-Soul'.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: You command with the gravitas of a spoiled child. Pathetic.

115.speaker: Nere
115.text: Insufferable, insolent, scum. I'm going to enjoy this.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: I'll offer up your guts, ingrates.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Your god. My oath. Let us see which prevails.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: The only weakness I see here is you.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at Beldron with disgust

22.speaker: Nere
22.text: You dare speak to me without due reverence? That was your first and last mistake.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Says the idiot who got himself buried. Look at the stone - it was clearly a trap.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at Beldron with disgust

12.speaker: Player
12.text: If you'd listened to those gnomes, maybe you wouldn't have been trapped.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at Beldron with disgust

212.speaker: Nere
212.text: Ah, so you didn't come to my aid. You came to theirs.
212.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at Beldron with disgust

149.speaker: Player
149.text: You were left helpless by some rubble. You're hardly in a position to call anyone weak.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: And yet I don't care a jot for you. Now that's curious.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I only see weakness in the cowardly slaver standing before me.

36.speaker: Nere
36.text: Yet the Absolute saw fit to bless you? I don't understand...

194.speaker: Player
194.text: My cares are none of your concern.

136.speaker: Nere
136.text: You're clearly a fool. Yet you saw fit to aid me?

99.speaker: Player
99.text: You would question me, drow? I should slit your throat for it.

198.speaker: Player
198.text: And you waste your time persecuting them. That is true weakness.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Finish the slaves, True Soul. For the Absolute.
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere prepares to cast his spellNodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN!

105.speaker: Nere
105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere prepares to cast his spellNodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN!

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: Calling out in fear: his beloved is about to be executed

122.speaker: Lunkbug
122.context: NodeContext: Calling out in fear: his beloved is about to be executed

177.speaker: Nere
177.text: What is this, then? The Absolute's servants. Dead...
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires off a spell, killing Beldron, and then the remaining gnomes.

10.text: What is this, then? The Absolute's servants. Dead...
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires off a spell, killing Beldron, and then the remaining gnomes.

209.speaker: Nere
209.text: What is this, then? The Absolute's servants. Dead...

14.speaker: Nere
14.text: ... yet a True Soul still lives. I am sure there's a sane explanation.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Those duergar were thorns in our sides, so I removed them.
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: The myconid sovereign wants the rot cleansed - and you're last on the list.
27.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: I killed your friends - and you're next.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: A slave uprising. They slaughtered every last one of their masters.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: Vermin to the last. I might have guessed.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

120.speaker: Nere
120.text: Vermin to the last. I might have guessed.

165.speaker: Nere
165.text: Vermin. As feral as they are useless.

154.text: *A fire blazes in your head, then spreads through your blood.*
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *A fire blazes in your head, then spreads through your blood.*
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

178.speaker: Nere
178.text: You are a liar - and a fool. Nere suffers neither!

45.speaker: Player
45.text: The slavers turned on each other - mutineers versus Absolute loyalists.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

56.text: Tensions were high - I am hardly surprised. The novices were lost without me to guide them.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

196.speaker: Nere
196.text: Tensions were high - I am hardly surprised. The novices were lost without me to guide them.
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

191.speaker: Nere
191.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

74.speaker: Nere
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

202.speaker: Nere
202.text: You've a chance yet to prove your faith. Kill the slaves. Let Nere see them suffer.
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

142.speaker: Player
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: You're the only one suffering today, Nere.
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

73.speaker: Nere
73.text: Traitor. You have breathed your last!

183.speaker: Player
183.text: Plant a thought in Nere's mind. 'The gnomes must be set free.'
183.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

199.speaker: Nere
199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

192.speaker: Nere
192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

200.speaker: Nere
200.text: Gnomes, you are slaves no longer. The Absolute may have use for you yet.
200.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnome slaves.

61.speaker: Nere
61.text: As for you, our charge is clear - there is more we must do.

193.text: I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.
193.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it and frowns at player.

175.speaker: Nere
175.text: I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it and frowns at player.

162.speaker: Nere
162.text: But you are a traitor. And I will have your head!

188.speaker: Nere
188.text: The outsider did me a favour. The duergar were trouble from the start.

40.speaker: Nere
40.text: The outsider did me a favour. The duergar were trouble from the start.

112.text: Fool. Did you think I wouldn't notice your intrusion?

134.speaker: Nere
134.text: Fool. Did you think I wouldn't notice your intrusion?

204.speaker: Nere
204.text: Nere is your death. The Absolute wills it!

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *Your head tingles as Nere scans the room.*
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

29.speaker: Nere
29.text: ... yet the faithless yet stand. Isn't that right, Brithvar?

159.speaker: Nere
159.text: Thrinn. The Absolute gave you everything. And this fiasco is how you reward Her?

179.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
179.text: Me and mine worked flat out. I was cracking the whip day and night! Tell him, True Soul!

133.speaker: Player
133.text: You were lazy, Thrinn. Without me, Nere would be dead.

153.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
153.text: No - no! I did everything right!

28.speaker: Player
28.text: It's true - you did your best.

210.speaker: Nere
210.text: Your best was not good enough.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I don't care about your squabble. I just want Nere's head.

150.speaker: Nere
150.text: My head? I walk among traitors.

95.speaker: Nere
95.text: Nere pities you, Thrinn. Your errors and excuses. And your sorry end.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Thrinn. Nere casts one final spell and Thrinn falls over dead.

89.speaker: Nere
89.text: *Your skull buzzes, and you see your own face through Nere's eyes.*

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *Your skull buzzes, and you see your own face through Nere's eyes.*

25.speaker: Nere
25.text: ... you've one final chance to prove your allegiance.

185.speaker: Nere
185.text: Cut down the duergar - every last one. The Absolute commands it!

102.speaker: Nere
102.text: Worthless, every last one. Their failures must be punished.

7.speaker: Nere
7.text: True Soul - take their heads. The Absolute commands it!

118.speaker: Nere
118.text: Show them no mercy. Their corpses will make a fine offering to our mistress!

181.speaker: Nere
181.text: Duergar - this True Soul has betrayed us. Let their blood prove your devotion!

43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
43.text: If it means getting paid, my blade's yours!

197.speaker: Player
197.text: The only head I mean to take is yours, Nere.

23.speaker: Elder Brithvar
23.text: Bloody hells, had enough of your shit.
23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Nere. Pulls out dagger and points it at Nere.

208.text: You come turnin' my people, strikin' Thrinn dead - and you still ain't paid up. Shell it out, ya prickhole!
208.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

215.speaker: Elder Brithvar
215.text: You come turnin' my people, strikin' Thrinn dead - and you still ain't paid up. Shell it out, ya prickhole!
215.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

103.speaker: Nere
103.text: Drop the blade, duergar. You shall have your coin.
103.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

41.speaker: Nere
41.text: True Soul - prove your faith. Strike him down.
41.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

91.speaker: Player
91.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

11.speaker: Nere
11.text: Heretics. Let Nere be your end.
11.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Attack Brithvar and the duergar rebels.

92.speaker: Nere
92.text: Damn it. I'll rip your flesh clean off!

66.speaker: Elder Brithvar
66.text: Damn it. I'll rip your flesh clean off!

116.speaker: Nere
116.text: Fool. Your silence speaks to your heresy. For the Absolute!

88.speaker: Nere
88.text: Brithvar. Did you think you could keep your plot a secret?

114.speaker: Elder Brithvar
114.text: You been a shit since I laid eyes on you, red-eye. Go on, try and gut me. I ain't going down easy.

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Your scalp buzzes as Nere's mind reaches out - not to you, but to the duergar elder.*
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere and Brithvar experience a mindmeld.

147.speaker: Elder Brithvar
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Nere. Pulls out dagger and points it at Nere.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Try winning the argument by yourself, why don't you. It'll build character.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Hmm? What? Sorry, I wasn't paying attention.

206.speaker: Player
206.text: You were needlessly cruel, Thrinn. You must pay the price.

203.speaker: Player
203.text: Your incompetence speaks for itself, duergar.

190.speaker: Nere
190.text: True Soul. Was it your hand that slayed Thrinn? No, of course not. There must be a sane explanation.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Touch another innocent and I'll take your head, Nere.
